DataElement.preferredName: Body Fluid or Substance Specimen Requirement Class Specimen Class Text Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Liquid and semi liquid substances produced by living organisms to fulfill specific functions or excreted as waste; does not include hormones or enzymes.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory._Class; a collection of things sharing a common attribute._Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes._Class; a collection of things sharing a common attribute._Text; the words of something written._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Body Fluid or Substance Specimen Requirement Class
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Liquid and semi liquid substances produced by living organisms to fulfill specific functions or excreted as waste; does not include hormones or enzymes.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory._Class; a collection of things sharing a common attribute.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Body Fluid or Substance Specimen Requirement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Liquid and semi liquid substances produced by living organisms to fulfill specific functions or excreted as waste; does not include hormones or enzymes.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory.

Concepts.definition: Material produced by living organisms; it can be a necessary constituent of, or product of an organismal process.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Class; a collection of things sharing a common attribute.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/28/10 Released for use in caTissue Suite version 1.1 and/or 1.2 per owners direction.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes._Class; a collection of things sharing a common attribute._Text; the words of something written._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container (i.e., a liquid or a gas).  Also used as an adjective to describe something with properties like that of a fluid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
